intro: Hemigraphis petola, commonly known as Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and blooms. Hemigraphis petola is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
